alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 2:16PM EDT until June 11 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL FAIRFIELD...CENTRAL LEXINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 215 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Oak Grove, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. This storm has a history of knocking down large trees. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Springdale, St. Andrews, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, Dentsville, Oak Grove, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Villages at Sandhill, Columbia International University, Killian, Harbison State Forest and Riverbanks Zoo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 47 and 82. Interstate 26 between mile markers 100 and 117. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 5, and between mile markers 9 and 30. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Murray move away from the water and take shelter! Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways or walk through high water.
